description: Canine parvovirus (CPV) belongs to the family Parvoviridae, the subfamily Parvovirinae and the genus Protoparvovirus (previously Parvovirus). The clinical form of canine parvovirus (CPV) was first reported in the United States in 1978 and the isolated virus was named CPV type-2 (CPV-2) to distinguished from canine parvovirus type 1 (CPV-1) which causes canine minute virus disease.
name: Canine Parvovirus Antibodies and Antigens
